item.title: PETER (not verified): Comment 1
item.dcterms:creator: PETER (not verified)
item.description: Please update this 2 tor browser bundle. thanx

item.title: AnonymousS (not verified): Comment 2
item.dcterms:creator: AnonymousS (not verified)
item.description: Roger Dingledine recently said that file sharing consumes the majority of Tor's overall bandwidth, and that this is considered to be a problem. I was just wondering whether you shouldn't simply invite these users by encouraging a network of non-exit file sharing clients who could provide a wealth of middle nodes that would prop up the network, not clog the exit nodes, and improve anonymity for Tor's more serious uses.

item.title: Anonymous (not verified): Comment 3
item.dcterms:creator: Anonymous (not verified)
item.description:
NLnet not only funds Tor, but also this one:
http://www.nlnet.nl/project/anomos/

Maybe the websiteshould say: If you want something for (legal ) anonymous File sharing, use Freenet, Gnunet, MUTE or any of the programs whith Ants in their logo.

You can find a more complete list here:
http://www.planetpeer.de/wiki/index.php/Main_Page

item.title: Anonymous (not verified): Comment 4
item.dcterms:creator: Anonymous (not verified)
item.description:
I still think the user should be allowed to use CircuitBuildTimeouts all the way down to 1. A sensible user will set this figure as low as their network will allow, raising it until their response time for circuits is acceptable.

This is what I do.
